page.title: 06OLD BUILDINGS,SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: Opposite Great Somerford Church there are two very old dwellings.The first of these,Avon Cottage,has been adapted from 3 small terraced cottages which were at least 300 years old.The rear part of the buildings being the most ancient.Originally the roofing was thatched but during the many changes over the years these have been replaced by Roman-style tiles.The old floorboards are 27cm.wide.These joined cottages once served as an old inn and 37 bags of straw were removed from the roof by the present owners.The inner walls are of wattle and daub. The second of these old houses is an Elizabethan timber-framed house,some 400 years old.The owner was probably poor as the timbers are spaced far apart.Since then wall-ties have strengthened the walls and extensions have been added at different times.
